method: In a large bowl, combine the pineapple juice, cumin, chili powder, garlic powder, onion powder, salt, and pepper.
Add the pork loin to the bowl and marinate for at least 1 hour.
Preheat the grill to medium-high heat.
Remove the pork loin from the marinade and discard the marinade.
Grill the pork loin for 15-20 minutes, or until cooked through and slightly charred.
Remove the pork from the grill and let it rest for 5 minutes.
Slice the pork loin into thin strips.
Heat the corn tortillas in a dry skillet over medium heat until warmed through.
Assemble the tacos by placing a few slices of pork loin onto each tortilla.
Top with mango salsa and enjoy the pork-a-potamus goodness!
